pullRequest.body:
Extracted from #21433; this PR does not try to *change* existing lemmas, but merely adds new versions.
Generalise a few lemmas to ENorm, to show that this is already useful.

Part of the Carleson project.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: @fpvandoorn Feel free to shepherd this along; this ought to be useful for generalising more material about Carleson.

### PR summary [1cfb53f456](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22175/commits/1cfb53f456a6176141ee8e78875be1cf3bdfe19a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eLpNorm'_congr_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNorm'_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm'_mono_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_le_of_ae_enorm_bound`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_lt_top_of_ae_enorm_bound`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_mono_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNorm_congr_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNorm_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm_le_of_ae_enorm_bound`
`+ eLpNorm_mono_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm_mono_enorm_ae`
`+ enorm'_eq_iff_norm_eq`
`+ enorm'_le_iff_norm_le`
`+ enorm_ae_le_eLpNormEssSup`
`+ enorm_enorm`
`- coe_nnnorm_ae_le_eLpNormEssSup`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13680589307/job/38251675680)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13680589307/job/38251676259)

LGTM

bors d+

LGTM

bors d+
given the name of the lemma, I'd expect the sides of the iff to be swapped.
`leq` should be `le`.
Is there a reason `C` doesn't live in `ENNReal`?
In any case, making it into an ENNReal also works: changed.
not sure what the point of this lemma is, compared to the lemma above, which is nicer. You could use `eLpNormEssSup_le_of_ae_bound_enorm` or something...
I don't remember if I actually used this lemma for anything. I have removed it for now; if a dependent PR needs it, I can always bring it back.
Has the lemma below changed since the start of this PR? Now it states the same, and should be renamed (+ deprecated) to this name.
I think it did, perhaps Yael's PR. Good catch!, fixed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add enorm versions of many nnnorm lemmas

source.title: chore: change more lemmas to be about enorm instead of nnnorm
